questions.question_text: What can cause Device Health Attestation to fail in Workspace ONE UEM for a Windows 10 Desktop device?

choices.C: Windows 10 does not support Device Health Attestation.
choices.D: A required managed app is missing.
choices.A: BitLocker status on boot is disabled.
choices.B: Windows Update Service is not enabled.

choices.D: Port 80 between device server and Exchange server opened.

discussion.content:
ABE

A service account that has Remote Shell access to Exchange Server and the minimum roles to integrate with PowerShell:
Organization Client Access Role
Mail Recipients Role
Recipient Policies Role (only needed when managing Windows Phone 7 and BlackBerry devices)
PowerShell minimum version of 5.1.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2102/WS1_PowerShell_Integration/GUID-AWT-INTRO-PWRSHLL.html

comments.content:
Question mentions that only iOS and Android is in use. With that in mind, Recipient Policies Role is not applicable.
Correct Answer: AE

discussion.content:
Its only A and E, B is only requried for windows 7 and Blackberry devices.
(https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1811/WS1-PowerShell-Integration.pdf)
There are three correct answers for this one: ABE

questions.question_text:
What are the minimum requirements for the PowerShell Mail integration with Microsoft Exchange service account when only iOS and Android devices are in use?
(Choose two.)

choices.B: The network traffic rules need to be reviewed.
choices.A: The tunnel app is not installed.
choices.D: The app has no per-app tunnel payload configured.
choices.C: The mobile device is in airplane mode.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is troubleshooting a per-app tunnel for an application on an iOS device. The general app communication to the internal server is working; however, the Internet-based license server on it cannot be reached.
What is most likely the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Download the log ZIP files from the Support Settings section of the admin UI.

These log files are collected from the /opt/vmware/gateway/logs directory on the appliance.
B is for UAG appliance but C is for Content Gateway. Page 12 https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/1902/WS1_Logging.pdf?hWord=N4IghgNiBc4HYBMBOB7AlggBAUzgF2yQAck0BnbEAXyA

comments.content:
I think RevanT answer's B is correct because the question mentions "on the UAG" and on the UAG you can find the file content-gateway.log in /opt/vmware/gateway/logs
https://docs.vmware.com/en/Unified-Access-Gateway/3.9/com.vmware.uag-39-deploy-config.doc/GUID-C16913E1-7984-4072-B1E8-7EBAE385A831.html

questions.question_text: Where are the content gateway-related log files located on the Unified Access Gateway (UAG)?
Which Console location should be used to troubleshoot a device?

choices.D: Groups & Settings > All Settings > Devices & Users > Advanced > Logs
choices.A: Monitor > Reports and Analytics > Events > Logs
choices.C: Monitor > Reports and Analytics > Events > Device Events

discussion.content: C. Monitor > Reports and Analytics > Events > Device Events
